import pandas as pd
import numpy as np 
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import plotly.express as px
import seaborn as sns
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

source.02f51fe2:
plt.figure(figsize=(30,10))
# sns.set(rc = None)
Top_50_plot = sns.barplot(data=Top_50, x="NOC", y="Discipline", linewidth =2, palette = sns.color_palette("dark", 
            n_colors=30))
plt.xticks(rotation = 90)
plt.xlabel("Top 50 countries", fontsize=20)
plt.ylabel("Total athletes", fontsize=20)
plt.title("Number of athletes from each country", fontsize=20)
plt.show()

source.7ff3bd80:
import plotly.graph_objects as go 

fig = go.Figure(data=[
    go.Bar(name="Male", y=gender["Discipline"], x=gender["Male"],
    orientation='h'),
    go.Bar(name="Female", y=gender["Discipline"], x=gender["Female"],
    orientation='h')
])

fig.update_layout(
barmode="group",
title={"x": 0.5, "xanchor":"center", 
"font_family":"Times New Roman", 
"text":"Comparison of Male and Female Athletes in each event"})
fig.show()
source.0bf6ceba:
import plotly.graph_objects as go 

fig = go.Figure(data=[
    go.Bar(name="Male", x=gender["Discipline"], y=gender["Male"],
 ),
    go.Bar(name="Female", x=gender["Discipline"], y=gender["Female"],
    )
])

fig.update_layout(
barmode="group", 
width=2000,
title={
"font_family":"Times New Roman", 
"text":"Comparison of Male and Female Athletes in each event"})
fig.show()
source.1c441d6d:
Males = gender.Male.sum()
Females = gender.Female.sum()
Difference = Males - Females
print("Total male participants: {}".format(Males))
print("Total female participants: {}".format(Females))
print("Difference in number : {}".format(Difference ))
source.e8542ec9:
male_female = [Males, Females]
labels = ["Males", "Females"]
fig = go.Figure(data=
go.Pie(values=male_female, labels=labels))

fig.update_layout(
title={"x": 0.5, "xanchor":"center", 
"font_family":"Times New Roman", 
"text":"Participation of Male and Female Athletes"})
fig.show()

Top_30 = medals.head(30)
plt.figure(figsize=(30,10))
sns.set( rc = {"axes.facecolor": "gray", "font.family":["Times New Roman"]} )
sns.barplot(data=Top_30, x="Rank by Total", y="Team/NOC", linewidth =2,
 palette = sns.color_palette("dark",
            n_colors=30))
plt.xticks(rotation = 90)
# plt.xlabel("Rank by Total", fontsize=20)
# plt.ylabel( "Discipline",fontsize=20)
plt.title("Rank by Total vs Team/NOC ", fontsize=20)
plt.show()

source.60e8cd46:
# Number of coaches from each country
fig = px.histogram(new_coach, x ="NOC", title = 'Number of coaches from each country'
,color_discrete_sequence =['indigo']*len(new_coach), 
width=800, height=500,)
fig.update_layout(
xaxis_title= "NOC", yaxis_title="Total Number of Coaches",
title={"x": 0.5, "xanchor":"center", 
"font_family":"Times New Roman"}, 
xaxis_tickangle=-45)
fig.show()
source.7f4d67c0:
# Number of coaches from each country
fig = px.histogram(new_coach, x ="Discipline", 
title = 'Total Number of Coaches in each Discipline'
,color_discrete_sequence =['indigo']*len(new_coach), 
width=1000, height=500,)
fig.update_layout(
xaxis_title= "Disciplines", yaxis_title="Total Number of Coaches",
font_family="Times New Roman", xaxis_tickangle=-45, 
title={"x": 0.5, "xanchor":"center"}
)
fig.show()
source.531862f1:
# Number of coaches from each country
fig = px.histogram(teams, x ="Discipline", 
title = 'Total Number of Disciplines'
,color_discrete_sequence =['indigo']*len(teams), 
width=1000, height=500,)
fig.update_layout(
xaxis_title= "Disciplines", yaxis_title="Count",
font_family="Times New Roman", xaxis_tickangle=-45, 
title={"x": 0.5, "xanchor":"center"}
)
fig.show()

source.e20bc76d: The Athletics event has the highest number of participants, followed Swimming, Football, and finally Rowing.
source.48417c6c: From the two charts above, USA has the highest tally of medals followed by China in second place, and ROC (Russia) in third place. Which corresponds with the Rank by total.
source.2764a299: Dropping the duplicates: the name which appeared twice was dropped from the dataset due to it being a duplicate.
source.97e7546a: From the chart above, USA has the highest tally of bronze medals followed by China in second place, and ROC (Russia) in third place. Again, Japan fell short of bronze medals. This shows that Japan lost it's third spot due to lack of both silver and bronze medals.
source.5e17c430: It seems USA has the highest number of athletes followed by Japan, Australia, China, and finally Germany.
source.31618e29: Artisitic swimming has the highest number of coaches followed by Hockey, and finally football.
source.7571e1db: The graph confirms that the USA has the highest number of athletes followed by Japan, Australia, China, and finally Germany. Nigeria came in 48th.
source.17603eb5:
The Olympics!! Let's see what we can do with this dataset. 
I chose to dataset to practice my EDA due to me being a beginner in ML.
source.4ebc0015: Nigeria's rank by Total is 66th in the Olympics
source.da29dad9: Japan, USA, and Italy are top three in team discipline.
source.c5bda1d3: From the graph Japan has the highest number of coaches, followed by Australia and finally the USA.
source.5da497eb: Swimming, athletics and cycling track are the top disciplines from first to third.
source.84a405dd: USA tops the charts in both Gold ranking and Total medals won in the Olympics.
source.4f7e8fcd: There are no null values in this dataset
source.82e9db8e:
From the two plots above there are no male contendants in both Artisic swimming and Rhythmic Gymnastics but more of female contendants. Females participated in all events of the Olympics.
The Athletics event has the highest number of both male and female participants.
source.94d2bb01: From the chart above, USA has the highest tally of gold medals followed by China in second place, and Japan in third place.
source.b0ed5448: From the chart above, USA has the highest tally of Silver medals followed by China in second place, and ROC(Russia) in third place. Japan fell short of Silver medals
